src:
Jepang Dukung Prioritas Program Pembangunan Jokowi
05 Nov 2019, 04:49 by Andhika Prasetia
Jakarta - Jepang akan memberikan dukungan sepenuhnya pada prioritas program pembangunan Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi) dalam masa pemerintahan periode kedua.
Hal ini disampaikan PM Jepang Shinzo Abe dalam pertemuan bilateral dengan Jokowi di sela-sela KTT ke-35 ASEAN yang dihelat di Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand, pada Senin, (4/11/2019).
Di awal pertemuan, Jokowi menjelaskan bahwa dalam 5 tahun ke depan, Indonesia memiliki beberapa prioritas utama pembangunan yaitu pembangunan sumber daya manusia, keberlanjutan pembangunan infrastruktur, penyederhanaan regulasi, dan reformasi kelembagaan.
"Dalam pertemuan ini, saya ingin fokus pada dua isu yaitu kerja sama infrastruktur dan peningkatan kualitas sumber daya manusia," kata Jokowi.
PM Abe menyambut baik prioritas utama pembangunan tersebut.
"Jepang tentunya ingin bekerjasama di bidang yang merupakan prioritas utama, terutama pembangunan infrastruktur dan sumber daya manusia," ucap Abe.
text:
Japan Supports Jokowi's Development Program Priorities
05 Nov 2019, 04:49 by Andhika Prasetia
Jakarta - Japan will give full support to the priority of President Joko Widodo's (Jokowi's) development program during the second term of government.
This was conveyed by Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe in a bilateral meeting with Jokowi on the sidelines of the ASEAN 35th Summit held at the Impact Exhibition and Convention Center, Bangkok, Thailand, on Monday (4/11/2019).
At the beginning of the meeting, Jokowi explained that in the next 5 years, Indonesia had several main development priorities, namely human resource development, sustainability of infrastructure development, simplification of regulations, and institutional reform.
"In this meeting, I want to focus on two issues, namely infrastructure cooperation and improving the quality of human resources," Jokowi said.
PM Abe welcomed the top development priorities.
"Japan certainly wants to work together in areas that are the top priority, especially infrastructure development and human resources," Abe said.
